body: 3Q
@candyleer Can you provide me your zipkin demo? I will do this in these days.
@SevenPointOld Could you finish this PR soon? I look forward to merge this pr into beta2 release.
How could this cause that? Can you be more specific?
the `TraceSegment` saved in es, but the `global_trace` is on the way to save to es. so some trace don't have global trace id.should wait for a moment

> the TraceSegment saved in es, but the global_trace is on the way to save to es. so some trace don't have global trace id.should wait for a moment

But the time is uncertain, it depends on the throughput. Do you have some ideas? From my experience, look like hard to say, except to do query multiple time, and filter half-save data.
@wu-sheng  I'll try to rewrite the match logic.

>  I'll try to rewrite the match logic.

Try to make it a simple and easy one, at the first edition.

I read the ui codes,maybe it's caused by 
in `getServiceTopology ` the `nodes` don't contain the calls `source`,only `target`

> I read the ui codes,maybe it's caused by
in getServiceTopology the nodes don't contain the calls source,only target

If `nodes` doesn't include all `source` and `target`, that should a backend bug.
Yes ,I am reading the backend method and try to fix it

@wu-sheng  I found the listener `public class ServiceReferenceMetricSpanListener implements EntrySpanListener, ExitSpanListener  `just parse the entry and exit span ,but in `cross thread` ,we create local span for it, so in es,`service_name` has service_id (36,44,-42),but service_metric_minute(or hour,day) didn't contain,so cannot found the nodes.
so that mean if we use cross thread and create exit span in it this issue may reproduce.
I am a little confused. Local span should be not part of analysis, and if EntrySpan and ExistSpan are in different segment, then should no dependencies.

it seems the dependencies are come from 
```
serviceReferenceMetricUIDAO.getFrontServices(step, startTimeBucket, endTimeBucket, MetricSource.Callee, serviceId)
```
```
serviceReferenceMetricUIDAO.getBehindServices(step, startTimeBucket, endTimeBucket, MetricSource.Caller, serviceId)
```
That is query for front and behind, but, that should not be the problem.
I need to rewrite the class of "com.github.danielwegener.logback.kafka.KafkaAppender"?

> I need to rewrite the class of "com.github.danielwegener.logback.kafka.KafkaAppender"?

I am not familiar with this appender, and it is definitely provided by SkyWalking project.  And I think it is not related to it. The root cause is how do you trace your kafka consume. At normal situation, you need to do some manual instrumentation for Kafka consumer side, e.g. https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/FAQ/kafka-plugin.md

Delay times will be more and more longer when collector received too much segments. I suggest that setting the end time at the 20 seconds before when query trace information.

Add check method into agent-collector protocol to avoid system exception when users clean all of the data in storage. It seems not the best solution. 
Why users clean all of the data?
1.  Upgrade collector
1. Reset system

The best solution is:
1. [Agent dynamic refresh](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/issues/1181)
1. Display all the agents which connecting to the collector in UI, and by click the `Reset` button to reset agents.
1. Better documentation.

@wu-sheng I guess you have found the root cause of the issue. Could you please describe your findings?

@ajanthan Look like you are facing this issue too. I can explain to you with more details. The reason I called this a design issue, it is in old days(3.x series), we have no such a powerful UI, just topology. Then in order to visualize conjecture nodes(such as: MySQL, Kafka, which would be installed an agent), we put the client library names as the server name. 

For example, we set component name of Kafka consumer as `Kafka`, only, which triggers the issue described in here. 

So we have to change this, and put the real component names in agent, then do component->server-side mapping for the UI. 

See https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1266 , that includes all the changes for this issue. But sadly, today's travis-ci has some network issues... fails all the time... can't merge it.
Undo. This can't be changed easily.

> In minute, our UI provides 1 hours, which means 60 mins. So the default setting should be 60.
 
Last 1 hour means 1 hour or 60 minutes? 
> In hour, we prefer the 3-7 days, which means 72-168 hours.

If you choose last 3 days, collector will query metrics from the day metric index, not minute metric index.
1hour is 60 mins in query.

>If you choose last 3 days, collector will query metrics from the day metric index, not minute metric index.

For last 3 days, I mean for ops people, or SRE, they need 3 days metrics in hours. To find out patterns of performance.

> For last 3 days, I mean for ops people, or SRE, they need 3 days metrics in hours. To find out patterns of performance.

But if you make hour TTL setting related to day TTL setting. Those four TTL setting are difficult to explain. I prefer make them not related by each others.

Coverage remained the same at 23.864% when pulling **d25752965e033c825d6b3a62cc625d8537e7444b on check-style-dependency** into **43da4e65d9b68ade6b67bf3711f469e7efef3b91 on master**.

@peng-yongsheng RC is not allowed to, or should say hope don't need, to add new feature. 

@hanahmily Can you confirm, do you want to do the new trace detail visualization based on segment(not span) in 5.1.0? If so, I think this issue will be not much useful.
Fixed this. By based on 5.0.0-beta release check style for a long time. We will make the check style module as an independency project.

This is not the responsibility of the collector which processes data from real nodes. The virtual nodes should be generated by the frontend one that has enough information about the trace.

In conclusion,  I prefer to close this issue.
